chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J. Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second or Subsequent Offense], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended.  AODA and follow up.  DNA sample.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
14CF1024:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-THC-PTAC)>> GUILTY.
Ct. 3 (Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd))>> GUILTY.
Ct. 7 (Felon Possess Firearm)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 8 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense))>> NO CONTEST.

15CF958:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>> GUILTY.

15CF1204:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g)-Repeater-Second or Subsequent Offense)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
14CF1024:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-THC-PTAC)>> 2 Years WSPS, 1 Year IC and 1 Year ES, consecutive to Ct. 7 in 14CF1024. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and follow up, Absolute sobriety from controlled substances, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Eligible for programming. Sentence Credit to be submitted as a Stipulation.

Ct. 3 (Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd))>> 45 Days MCJ, concurrent to all counts and cases, $600 fine plus Court Costs, IID for 24 Months, 24 Months DL revocation, AODA and follow up, Counseling as recommended.

Ct. 7 (Felon Possess Firearm)>> 10 Years WSPS, 5 Years IC and 5 Years ES, consecutive to Ct. 1 in 14CF1024. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and follow up, Absolute sobriety from controlled substances, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Eligible for programming. Sentence Credit to be submitted as a Stipulation.

Ct. 8 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense))>> 3 1/2 Years WSPS, 1 1/2 Years IC and 2 Years ES concurrent to all counts and cases. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and follow up, Absolute sobriety from controlled substances, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Eligible for programming. Sentence Credit to be submitted as a Stipulation.

15CF958:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>> 6 Years WSPS, 3 Years IC and 3 Years ES, concurrent to all counts and cases. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and follow up, Absolute sobriety from controlled substances, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Eligible for programming. Sentence Credit to be submitted as a Stipulation.

15CF1204:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g)-Repeater-Second or Subsequent Offense)>> 12 Years WSPS, 6 Years IC and 6 Years, concurrent to all counts and cases. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and follow up, Absolute sobriety from controlled substances, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Eligible for programming. Sentence Credit to be submitted as a Stipulation.

Cash Bonds to be used for Court Costs and the rest to be returned to Defendant. Clark County Bond to be returned to Poster.
